verses.verse: A Psalm of Asaph. Surely God <S%H430><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> to Israel <S%H3478><s%>, Even to such as are pure <S%H1249><s%> in heart <S%H3824><s%>.
But as for me <S%H7272><s%>, my feet were almost <S%H4592><s%> gone <S%H5186><s%>; My steps <S%H838><s%> had well nigh <S%H369><s%> slipped <S%H8210><s%>.
For I was envious <S%H7065><s%> at the arrogant <S%H1984><s%>, When I saw <S%H7200><s%> the prosperity <S%H7965><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.
For there are no pangs <S%H2784><s%> in their death <S%H4194><s%>; But their strength <S%H193><s%> is firm <S%H1277><s%>.
They are not in trouble <S%H5999><s%> as other men <S%H582><s%>; Neither are they plagued <S%H5060><s%> like <S%H5973><s%> other men <S%H120><s%>.
Therefore pride <S%H1346><s%> is as a chain <S%H6059><s%> about their neck <S%H2555><s%>; Violence covereth <S%H5848><s%> them as a garment <S%H7897><s%>.
Their eyes <S%H5869><s%> stand out <S%H3318><s%> with fatness <S%H2459><s%>: They have more <S%H5674><s%> than heart <S%H3824><s%> could wish <S%H4906><s%>.
They scoff <S%H4167><s%>, and in wickedness <S%H7451><s%> utter <S%H1696><s%> oppression <S%H6233><s%>: They speak <S%H1696><s%> loftily <S%H4791><s%>.
They have set <S%H8371><s%> their mouth <S%H6310><s%> in the heavens <S%H8064><s%>, And their tongue <S%H3956><s%> walketh <S%H1980><s%> through the earth <S%H776><s%>.
Therefore his people <S%H5971><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> hither <S%H1988><s%>: And waters <S%H4325><s%> of a full <S%H4392><s%> cup are drained by them <S%H4680><s%>.
And they say <S%H559><s%>, How doth God <S%H410><s%> know <S%H3045><s%>? And is there <S%H3426><s%> knowledge <S%H1844><s%> in the Most High <S%H5945><s%>?
Behold <S%H7563><s%>, these are the wicked; And <S%H5769><s%>, being alway at ease <S%H7961><s%>, they increase <S%H7685><s%> in riches <S%H2428><s%>.
Surely in vain <S%H7385><s%> have I cleansed <S%H2135><s%> my heart <S%H3824><s%>, And washed <S%H7364><s%> my hands <S%H3709><s%> in innocency <S%H5356><s%>;
For all the day <S%H3117><s%> long have I been plagued <S%H5060><s%>, And chastened <S%H8433><s%> every morning <S%H1242><s%>.
If I had said <S%H559><s%>, I will speak <S%H559><s%> thus <S%H3644><s%>; Behold <S%H898><s%>, I had dealt treacherously with the generation <S%H1755><s%> of thy children <S%H1121><s%>.
When I thought <S%H2803><s%> how I might know <S%H3045><s%> this <S%H5999><s%>, It was too painful for me <S%H5869><s%>;
Until I went <S%H935><s%> into the sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> of God <S%H410><s%>, And considered <S%H995><s%> their latter end <S%H319><s%>.
Surely thou settest <S%H7896><s%> them in slippery places <S%H2513><s%>: Thou castest them down <S%H5307><s%> to destruction <S%H4876><s%>.
How are they become a desolation <S%H8047><s%> in a moment <S%H7281><s%>! They are utterly <S%H5486><s%> consumed <S%H8552><s%> with terrors <S%H1091><s%>.
As a dream <S%H2472><s%> when one awaketh <S%H6974><s%>, So <S%H136><s%>, O Lord, when thou awakest <S%H5782><s%>, thou wilt despise <S%H959><s%> their image <S%H6754><s%>.
For my soul <S%H3824><s%> was grieved <S%H2556><s%>, And I was pricked <S%H8150><s%> in my heart <S%H3629><s%>:
So brutish <S%H1198><s%> was I <S%H3045><s%>, and ignorant; I was as a beast before thee <S%H929><s%>.
Nevertheless I am continually <S%H8548><s%> with thee <S%H270><s%>: Thou hast holden my right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3027><s%>.
Thou wilt guide <S%H5148><s%> me with thy counsel <S%H6098><s%>, And afterward <S%H310><s%> receive <S%H3947><s%> me to glory <S%H3519><s%>.
Whom have I in heaven <S%H8064><s%> but thee <S%H776><s%>? And there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee <S%H2654><s%>.

My flesh <S%H7607><s%> and my heart <S%H3824><s%> faileth <S%H3615><s%>; But God <S%H430><s%> is the strength <S%H6697><s%> of my heart <S%H3824><s%> and my portion <S%H2506><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>.
For <S%H7369><s%>, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish <S%H6><s%>: Thou hast destroyed <S%H6789><s%> all them that play the harlot <S%H2181><s%>, departing from thee.

But <S%H589><s%> it is good <S%H2896><s%> for me to draw near <S%H7132><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%>: I have made <S%H7896><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> Jehovah <S%H136><s%> my refuge <S%H4268><s%>, That I may tell <S%H5608><s%> of all thy works <S%H4399><s%>.
